communications.subject: Iowa Open Records Law Request: Agency Roster (Iowa State Patrol)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Iowa Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide records sufficient to show a current staff roster of all sworn employees with your agency.

Please include;
- first and last name of each employee with their corresponding;
- badge number
- employee identification number
- hire date
- rank or position
- assigned duty station/substation/precinct/location
- current salary

This request applies to ALL sworn Department employees, including those at substations.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Marcus Boyd

Any contracts between the  Education Department and the Institute for Curriculum Services, and the content of any professional development materials or presentations prepared by the Institute Curriculum Services for the Education Department since October 7th, 2022. Sincerely,

Alex Kane

title: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (Consumer Financial Protection Bureau)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (Consumer Financial Protection Bureau)
communications.communication:
Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau,

On behalf of myself and Fiat Fiendum, I hereby request the following records:

1. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email inbox or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
2. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email spam folder or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
3. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's sent email folder or equivalent which was sent nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
4. The total full-time equivalent count of people who work for your FOIA office as of October 19, 2024.

This request is expressly limited to Consumer Financial Protection Bureau's own FOIA office. Please do not refer it to any other agency or division. This request is expressly not a Privacy Act request, and no PA waiver will be provided.

Please provide the email records in EML, Maildir, MBOX, MIX, MSG, or PST format only — not PDF, Word, image, etc — including all metadata (e.g. full email headers as received/sent) and attachments, without alteration other than narrowly tailored electronic redaction of specifically claimed exemptions that do not affect any part of non exempt information (and, in particular, without rasterization).

Please provide the fourth record as a statement in your response letter, or at your option, as the most readily available record, in original electronic format as currently stored on your computer systems, which includes that information.

Please provide all records either as individual files, or as an unencrypted ZIP file, uploaded to MuckRock. Do not apply any encryption, DRM, or other restriction.

I request fee waiver, because
* Fiat Fiendum is a 501(c)(3) non-profit;
* this request is for public interest, non-commercial purposes;
* these records would give a snapshot of insight into the everyday processes of FOIA offices; and
* these records are being requested in order to conduct a government-wide audit of agencies' FOIA compliance.

In the event that you deny fee waiver, please process this request as-is, because I will not agree to any fees.

Please be sure to provide:
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(II) FOIA Public Liaison information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(aa) appeal information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(bb) OGIS information
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(A) tracking number
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(B)(ii) completion ETA

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
Sai
President, Fiat Fiendum, Inc.

P.S. Sai is my full legal name.

title: Dutchess County Excited Delirium Training Materials

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Dutchess County Excited Delirium Training Materials
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all training materials used in the past four years (January 1, 2020 through January 1, 2024) that mention excited delirium / agitated delirium / bell's mania / lethal catatonia.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jenny Wadhwa

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Dutchess County Excited Delirium Training Materials
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Wadhwa,

       This is in response to your FOIL request, which was received on October 29, 2024, and is part of the email thread below, where you request all training materials used in the past four years that mention excited delirium, agitated delirium, bell’s mania and lethal catatonia. Please be advised that your request will be granted or denied in whole or in part within in 20 business days. Thank you.
            Please take notice that you may within thirty days appeal in writing this response pursuant to NY Public Officers Law Section 89(4)(a) to the Dutchess County Attorney, Caroline E.  Blackburn, 22 Market Street, Poughkeepsie, NY  12601, tel. (845) 486-2110. The original FOIL request and response should accompany the appeal.  An appeal is not complete unless it contains
1)    the date and location of requests for records;
2)    a description, to the extent possible, of the records that were denied; and
3)    the name and return address of the appellant.

Detective Charles P. Locke

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Dutchess County Excited Delirium Training Materials
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Wadhwa,

       This is a follow up to your FOIL request received on October 29, 2024, which is a part of this email thread, where you request all training materials used in the past four years that mention excited delirium, agitated delirium, bell’s mania and lethal catatonia. Please find in the above attachment titled Article 35 which is the use of Deadly Physical Force where excited delirium is mentioned. Also please note that in the Defensive tactics attachment the phrases you cite are not specifically used, measures are used to protect an individual during arrest. I may also add that many of our officers take a 40 hour Crisis Individual Training class which deals with individuals in crisis and is put on by People USA. Thank you.

A copy of the order or policy issued 25 March 2020 that suspended movement in and out of the CENTCOM area of responsibility due to COVID19.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

George Johnston

On March 25, 2020:
Subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Order

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following
records:

A copy of the order or policy issued 25 March 2020 that suspended movement
in and out of the CENTCOM area of responsibility due to COVID19.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and
this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me
of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the
request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM
if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look
forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days,
as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

George Johnston

Filed via MuckRock.com

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #24-F-0926
communications.communication:
Good morning Mr. Johnston,



This email is in response to your request for the status of your March 25, 
2020, FOIA request number 24-F-0926, which was referred to the OSD/JS FOIA 
office on March 8, 2024.  A copy of your request is attached for your 
convenience.



Based on the circumstances of the search for responsive records, we anticipate 
that a response to your request should be made available by August 30, 2024. 
Please note that this date is subject to change should further searches or 
reviews be necessary.



If you have any other questions please let me know.



V/r,



Zachary J. Daniel

Government Information Specialist

Freedom of Information Division

OSD/JS FOIA Requester Service Center

Desk: (703) 693-6489

NIPR: zachary.j.daniel3.civ@mail.mil <mailto:zachary.j.daniel3.civ@mail.mil>

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Mobile Device Management software
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents and manuals relating to the implementation of Microsoft Intune and other mobile device management software installed on city-owned devices.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: Seattle Information Technology :: C151097-090623

communications.subject: City of Seattle Public Records Request Center - Invoice Ready :: C151097-090623
communications.communication:
Dear Rose Terse, 
 
Records in response to your public disclosure request C151097-090623 received on September 06, 2023 are now available. The cost for the records is as follows: 
 
Invoice Number: INV23-C151097-1 
Total: $1.25 
 
To pay online, please follow these steps: 
 Please note that you will need to disable any pop-up blockers to make a payment using the system. 
 
  * Navigate to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * Select 'My Records Request Center'. 
  * Select 'View My Requests'. You may be asked to login. 
  * Find this request: C151097-090623. 
  * Select the 'View Invoices' button. 
 
  * Opens a pop-up window showing your invoice: INV23-C151097-1. 
  * Click on the invoice and then the 'Pay Now' button. 
  * Continue processing your payment. 
  * Select 'Done'. 
  * Once the payment process is done, you are returned to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * After your payment is successful you will receive an email from our payments center. 
Once your payment has been approved, we will send you an email with instructions on how to download your records. Note that City staff must manually upload records. Records will be available one to two business days after payment. 
 
Please let your public disclosure officer (PDO) know if you are unable to pay online; your PDO will work with you on alternative ways to make your payment. 
 
You have 30 days from today's date to pay for your records. If the City does not receive your payment within this time period, your request will be considered abandoned, and you will need to submit a new request. 
 Please add seattle@mycusthelp.net to your E-mail contacts/address book to ensure delivery of the record center E-mails to your Inbox. (mailto:seattle@mycusthelp.net) 
This is an auto-generated email and has originated from an unmonitored email account. Please DO NOT REPLY.

We would like to provide further clarification on these records. The .Tif files are a placeholder for the Native files.  The “Document Produced as Native” is not an error message but the placeholder message we’ve created to indicate that the native file vs. a PDF is available to you for review in the "native" folder included in your installment.  .Tif files are generated so parent records and their attachments are produced together and it’s easy to tell which native file belongs to a which parent record. If you are having issues accessing the "native" folder please, let us know. Sincerely, Information Technology Department

communications.communication:
Dear Rose Terse, 
 
Thank you for your recent payment to the City of Seattle Public Records Request Center on 03/11/2024. 
 Within one to two business days, you will receive an email from your public disclosure officer indicating your records are available and instructing you on how to retrieve them. Public Disclosure Request Number: C151097-090623 Invoice Number: INV24-C151097-2 Payment Date: 03/11/2024 Invoice Status: Paid 
 
You can view your payments by logging in to the Public Records Request Center. 
 Please add seattle@mycusthelp.net to your E-mail contacts/address book to ensure delivery of the record center E-mails to your Inbox. (mailto:seattle@mycusthelp.net) 
This is an auto-generated email and has originated from an unmonitored email account. Please DO NOT REPLY.

communications.subject: Seattle Information Technology :: C151097-090623
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

Dear Rose Terse, 
Records are now available in response to your request C151097-090623 regarding the following: To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

All documents and manuals relating to the implementation of Microsoft Intune and other mobile device management software installed on city-owned devices. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Rose Terse 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fdepartment-of-information-technology-795%252Fmobile-device-management-software-151673%252F%253Femail%253Ditd_pdr%252540seattle.gov&url_auth_token=AAAdo3aESP6c5l5tdbnrMNB_0Qg%3A1qe5Ku%3AF7of2NtjD0K_aTAw-L5FRehihUL2i0c5MXBW59wPEtc 
The records being made available to you at this time include the following: All documents and manuals relating to the implementation of Microsoft Intune and other mobile device management software installed on city-owned devices 
To download your records, please: 
 
  * Navigate to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * Select 'My Records Request Center'. 
  * Select 'View My Requests'. You may be asked to login. 
  * Select this request: C151097-090623. 
  * Select the 'View Files' button. 
  * You can download records individually or all at the same time by clicking 'Download All'. 
  *  Please save your records as you may only download them from the system three times. If you do not download your records within 30 days of request closure, the link to your records will expire. 
If you believe you have received privileged or confidential records in error, please notify the City of Seattle immediately, through the Public Records Request Center or by email. Privileged or confidential records provided or received in error should not be reviewed, used, disseminated, distributed, or copied, and should be destroyed immediately. Thank you in advance for your cooperation. 
Due to the size and scope of your request, we are providing records to you in installments. We anticipate that the next installment of records will be available on or about 4/19/2024. 
Sincerely, 
Information Technology Department

communications.subject: City of Seattle Public Records Request Center - Invoice Ready :: C151097-090623
communications.communication:
Dear Rose Terse, 
 
Records in response to your public disclosure request C151097-090623 received on September 06, 2023 are now available. The cost for the records is as follows: 
 
Invoice Number: INV24-C151097-3 
Total: $1.25 
 
To pay online, please follow these steps: 
 Please note that you will need to disable any pop-up blockers to make a payment using the system. 
 
  * Navigate to the Public Records Request Center.
  * Select 'My Records Request Center'. 
  * Select 'View My Requests'. You may be asked to login. 
  * Find this request: C151097-090623. 
  * Select the 'View Invoices' button. 
 
  * Opens a pop-up window showing your invoice: INV24-C151097-3. 
  * Click on the invoice and then the 'Pay Now' button. 
  * Continue processing your payment. 
  * Select 'Done'. 
  * Once the payment process is done, you are returned to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * After your payment is successful you will receive an email from our payments center. 
Once your payment has been approved, we will send you an email with instructions on how to download your records. Note that City staff must manually upload records. Records will be available one to two business days after payment. 
 
Please let your public disclosure officer (PDO) know if you are unable to pay online; your PDO will work with you on alternative ways to make your payment. 
 
You have 30 days from today's date to pay for your records. If the City does not receive your payment within this time period, your request will be considered abandoned, and you will need to submit a new request. 
 Please add seattle@mycusthelp.net to your E-mail contacts/address book to ensure delivery of the record center E-mails to your Inbox. (mailto:seattle@mycusthelp.net) 
This is an auto-generated email and has originated from an unmonitored email account. Please DO NOT REPLY.

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request #C151097-090623
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Please find enclosed a check for $1.25 to satisfy the fee associated with the attached public records request.

Thank you.

communications.subject: Customer Satisfaction Survey - C151097-090623
communications.communication:
RE: Public Disclosure Request Number - C151097-090623 
 
Dear Rose Terse: 
 
Thank you for submitting your public records request through the City of Seattle's Public Records Request Center. We would like to invite you to take a short six-question survey on your experience. 
 
Please click the following link if you would like to participate.

title: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (Postal Regulatory Commission)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (Postal Regulatory Commission)
communications.communication:
Dear Postal Regulatory Commission,

On behalf of myself and Fiat Fiendum, I hereby request the following records:

1. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email inbox or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
2. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email spam folder or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
3. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's sent email folder or equivalent which was sent nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
4. The total full-time equivalent count of people who work for your FOIA office as of October 19, 2024.

This request is expressly limited to Postal Regulatory Commission's own FOIA office. Please do not refer it to any other agency or division. This request is expressly not a Privacy Act request, and no PA waiver will be provided.

Please provide the email records in EML, Maildir, MBOX, MIX, MSG, or PST format only — not PDF, Word, image, etc — including all metadata (e.g. full email headers as received/sent) and attachments, without alteration other than narrowly tailored electronic redaction of specifically claimed exemptions that do not affect any part of non exempt information (and, in particular, without rasterization).

Please provide the fourth record as a statement in your response letter, or at your option, as the most readily available record, in original electronic format as currently stored on your computer systems, which includes that information.

Please provide all records either as individual files, or as an unencrypted ZIP file, uploaded to MuckRock. Do not apply any encryption, DRM, or other restriction.

I request fee waiver, because
* Fiat Fiendum is a 501(c)(3) non-profit;
* this request is for public interest, non-commercial purposes;
* these records would give a snapshot of insight into the everyday processes of FOIA offices; and
* these records are being requested in order to conduct a government-wide audit of agencies' FOIA compliance.

In the event that you deny fee waiver, please process this request as-is, because I will not agree to any fees.

Please be sure to provide:
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(II) FOIA Public Liaison information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(aa) appeal information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(bb) OGIS information
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(A) tracking number
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(B)(ii) completion ETA

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
Sai
President, Fiat Fiendum, Inc.

P.S. Sai is my full legal name.

communications.subject: PRC FOIA Request No. 25-28
communications.communication:
Sai, Fiat Fiendum, Inc.:

This email is in response to your request under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), received on October 22, 2024, in which you requested:

1. The one email in the Commission’s chief FOIA officer's email inbox or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
2. The one email in the Commission’s chief FOIA officer's email spam folder or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
3. The one email in the Commission’s chief FOIA officer's sent email folder or equivalent which was sent nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
4. The total full-time equivalent count of people who work for your FOIA office as of October 19, 2024.

The Commission has conducted a search, which revealed three responsive records.  We are releasing two records in full and withholding one under FOIA exemption 5 U.S.C. § 552(b)(5) as it contains attorney-client privileged information, and the release of such information will cause foreseeable harm. We do not have any records that are responsive to number 4, and FOIA does not require an agency to create records.  In addition, we are providing the records in PDF as we do not have the ability to securely release records in any other format. We are also sending these via email as uploading documents to a site not approved is a violation of government cybersecurity policy.

Your request for a fee waiver is moot since fees were not assessed for the processing of your request.

You may appeal this response by filing an appeal within ninety (90) days, in the following ways:

By filing an appeal at the following address:

David A. Trissell, Chief FOIA Officer
Postal Regulatory Commission
901 New York Avenue, NW, Suite 200
Washington, DC 20268-0001
E-mail: foia@prc.gov<mailto:foia@prc.gov>

Additionally, the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) was created by way of a 2007 amendment to the FOIA to provide mediation services to resolve disputes between FOIA requesters and federal agencies as a non-exclusive alternative to litigation.  Using the OGIS for mediation does not affect your right to pursue litigation. You may contact OGIS in any of the following ways:

Office of Government Information Services
National Archives and Records Administration
8601 Adelphi Road
College Park, MD 20740-6001
Email: ogis@nara.gov<mailto:ogis@nara.gov>
Tel.: 202-741-5770
Fax: 202-741-5769

If you need further assistance or would like to discuss any aspect of your request, please do not hesitate to contact the Commission’s FOIA Public Liaison, Gail Adams, in any of the following ways:

Postal Regulatory Commission
FOIA Public Liaison
901 New York Avenue, NW, Suite 200
Washington, DC 20268-0001
Email: gail.adams@prc.gov<mailto:gail.adams@prc.gov>
Tel.: 202-789-6800

Your request has been assigned tracking number 25-28.  Please refer to this number in any future correspondence pertaining to this request.

I hope that you find this information useful.

Sincerely,

/s/ David A. Trissell, Chief FOIA Officer
Postal Regulatory Commission
901 New York Avenue, NW, Suite 200
Washington, DC 20268-0001

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #25-28
communications.communication:
Dear PRC,

Thank you for your extraordinarily prompt response and partial release. I appeal your denial of my form and format request.

You said for the first two items (i.e. the only released emails) that you are releasing the records in full. Given that you are not claiming any exemptions, therefore nothing to redact, and your ability to "securely" release records is irrelevant. Likewise, you haven't claimed any withholding for the email headers or structural metadata, which were destroyed by your export to PDF, so those must be released as requested.

The form and format request is mandatory under 5 USC 552(a)(3)(B & C), (f)(2)(A) (E-FOIA and FOIA Improvement Act) and 29 USC 794d (Rehab Act § 508). Any email client or server can easily save the emails in one of the formats requested. It is "readily reproducible in that form or format", which is the legal standard.

Sincerely,
Sai

title: Massive Blue (Texas Department of Public Safety)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Massive Blue (Texas Department of Public Safety)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Public reports state that departments in you state have partnered with Massive Blue, an AI company (discussed at recent county council meeting). 

Therefore, I hereby request the following records:

1) All instructional materials, presentations and presentation materials (including recorded video and audio, PowerPoint files, prepared remarks, and slides formats), and other guidance on the use of Massive Blue, "Overwatch," VIPS (Virtual Investigator Protection Service), RADAR: (Realtime active data aggregation reporter), and/or ITFM System (Investigative Task Force multiplier). This includes A) any notes taken during meetings that discussed the use of Massive Blue/Overwatch, B) any explanations (whether internally or externally generated) of how Massive Blue/Overwatch works, and C) any other document that has been used to help explain the use of Massive Blue/Overwatch, including internal documentation, public relations materials, and executive summaries.

2) A copy of any privacy impact assessments, use policies, technical explainers or assessments, standard operating procedures, data retention policies, legal opinions or assessments, warranties, non-disclosure agreements, contracts, liability waivers, insurance agreements, Requests for Proposals, Responses to Requests for Proposal, Memorandums of Understanding, Letters of Interest, usage policies, or informal agreements between the police department/this office and Massive Blue.

3) A copy of any funding opportunity announcements, grant applications and grantor status/progress reports, reports to legislative bodies, annual reports that mention Massive Blue/Overwatch, as well as audit records, including but not limited to security audits of the software, misuse reports, and reports to oversight bodies.

4) Any digital communications including but not limited to emails and text messages) as well as documents, (including but not limited to PDF, word processing, excel, and slide documents) that mention Massive Blue or sent to/from email addresses with the @massiveblue.ai domain.

5) Any case reports in which Overwatch/Massive Blue was used.

6) Any digital communications (including but not limited to emails and text messages) with Massive Blue representatives.

7) Any digital communications / presentations / contracts (including but not limited to emails and text messages) with employees of the Arizona Department of Public Safety about this project.

Please try to include any other miscellaneous documents that facilitate this department's relationship with Massive Blue or overwatch that don't neatly fall neatly into the above categories. Please search between January 1, 2023 and the time this request is published.

The requested documents will be used in the course of reporting for 404 Media, an independent technology journalism website: www.404media.co

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jason Koebler

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Sustainable Community Schools, 5 vendors
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Provide records sufficient to show the following:

1) A list of schools that America Scores Chicago, Brighton Park Neighborhood Council, SGA Youth and Family Services, Kenwood Oakland Community Organization, and Southwest Organizing Project have served in school years 2023-2024 and 2024-2025 to date.

Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
Due to the volume and complexity of requests received in the normal course of business, CPS is extending the time for its initial response to your request by an additional 5 business days (to 10 business days total beginning on the first business day following receipt of the request) pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/3(e)(v) which allows for the examination and evaluation of the requested records by personnel to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of Illinois FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the CPS FOIA Center.

communications.subject: Non-Commercial FOIA Request :: N016416-102924
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
December 2, 2024 Miriam Bhimani 
RE: Chicago Public Schools FOIA Request N016416-102924 
Dear Miriam Bhimani: This letter is in reply to your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request seeking the following information: 
1) A list of schools that America Scores Chicago, Brighton Park Neighborhood Council, SGA Youth and Family Services, Kenwood Oakland Community Organization, and Southwest Organizing Project have served in school years 2023-2024 and 2024-2025 to date. 
2) Copies of all invoices from America Scores Chicago, Brighton Park Neighborhood Council, SGA Youth and Family Services, Kenwood Oakland Community Organization, and Southwest Organizing Project have served in school years 2023-2024 and 2024-2025 to date for each school which they serve. 
3) Copies of records of payments by CPS/Chicago Board of Education to America Scores Chicago, Brighton Park Neighborhood Council, SGA Youth and Family Services, Kenwood Oakland Community Organization, and Southwest Organizing Project for the above noted time frames. I want the actual bills as well as proof of payment by the district or school, as the case may be. RESPONSE : Documents responsive to your FOIA request are available to download via the Chicago Public Schools FOIA Center. Please visit the following link and enter your username and password to access the records: http://cps.edu/About_CPS/Departments/Law/Pages/FOIARequest.aspx . Under the rules of FOIA, private information and unique identifiers contained within public records are exempt from disclosure; those portions have been redacted including p ursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7 (1)(b), “Private information, unless disclosure is required by another provision of this Act, a State or federal law or a court order,” and pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(c), “Personal information contained within public records, the disclosure of which would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, unless the disclosure is consented to in writing by the individual subjects of the information. “Unwarranted invasion of personal privacy” means the disclosure of information that is highly personal or objectionable to a reasonable person and in which the subject’s right to privacy outweighs the legitimate public interest in obtaining the information. The disclosure of information that bears on the public duties of public employees and officials shall not be considered an invasion of personal privacy. Redactions have been made pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(a) corresponding with 105 ILCS 5/34-18.5(b) which prohibits the release of background check information. To the extent you consider this a denial of your request, pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a) you may file a Request for Review with the Public Access Counselor (PAC) at: Public Access Counselor; Office of the Attorney General; 500 South 2nd Street; Springfield, IL 62706 . You also have the right to seek judicial review of your denial by filing a lawsuit in the State circuit court; 5 ILCS 140/11.  Thank you for your request. Sincerely, Ana Diaz Freedom of Information Act Officer Chicago Public Schools

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maine Freedom of Access Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records Retention Schedules
Employee Name / Title / Salary List
Organizational Chart
Master List of Forms
FOAA Log (If kept)

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by 1 M.R.S.A. § 408(6). The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

Sincerely,

Corey Bouchard

communications.subject: Your FOAA Request
communications.communication:
Good morning,
We have recently conducted a review of open FOAA requests to the Department of the Secretary of State.  It appears, through this review, that the request you submitted for the following records remains open:

  *   Record retention schedules.
  *   Employee name, title, and salary list
  *   Organizational chart
  *   Master List of Forms
  *   FOAA log.
We have records that are responsive to much of this request. However, it is unclear what is meant by a "master list of forms".  Will you please provide additional details about the list of forms you seek? Is this for the entire department or for the Bureau of Motor Vehicles?
Apologies for the delay.


Freedom of Access Act (FOAA) Coordinator
Maine Secretary of State
148 State House Station, Augusta, Me 04333
FOAA.SOS@maine.gov

[cid:image001.png@01DB1AF3.D7BD8AE0]

files.source: Secretary of State, Bureau of Motor Vehicles, Maine

communications.subject: Your Freedom of Access Act Request
communications.communication:
Good afternoon,

I am writing on behalf of the Maine Department of the Secretary of State. This is a response to your Freedom of Access Act request of June 30, 2023 (see attached).

We have attached the responsive records held by this department.  Please note the department does not have records responsive to your request for a FOAA log.  Also, we were unable to produce a "master list of forms".  Please provide some clarification of what records you seek in that regard. Our staff will determine if we have records responsive to that request as soon as we receive your clarification.


Please contact us if you have any questions.


Freedom of Access Act (FOAA) Coordinator
Maine Secretary of State
148 State House Station, Augusta, Me 04333
FOAA.SOS@maine.gov

[cid:image001.png@01DB214E.07B15730]

communications.subject: Your Freedom of Access Act Request
communications.communication:
Good afternoon,
I am writing on behalf of the Maine Department of the Secretary of State. The purpose of this email is to follow up on a Freedom of Access Act Request that you submitted in June of 2023.

In October, we sent an email to you with most of the responsive records that you requested. We were not able to produce a "master list of forms" per your request, and asked for clarification of what records you seek.  This department does not have records responsive to that request. As such, and as we have not received an amended request,  we consider the response sent on 10/18/24 complete and are closing your request.

Please do not hesitate to contact us if you would like to submit an additional request or amend your request for a master list of forms.

Thank you.

Freedom of Access Act (FOAA) Coordinator
Maine Secretary of State
148 State House Station, Augusta, Me 04333
FOAA.SOS@maine.gov

title: Men Firing Rifles on Washington St.

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Men Firing Rifles on Washington St.
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to any and all records, reports, or other documents related to the incident on 9 November, 2024 at approximately 9:10 AM in the vicinity of E. Washington St & 3rd St, wherein two individuals were reported walking down the street, brandishing and discharging long arms. Specifically, I request:

911 Call Records
- Audio recordings, transcripts, and logs of the 911 call(s) made regarding this incident, including my own call and any other calls reporting the same or related events.
- Information about any calls to non-emergency police lines related to this incident.

Law Enforcement Actions
- Reports of any police interactions with witnesses, suspects, or other individuals regarding the incident.
- Notes, narratives, or descriptions of actions taken by responding officers or investigators.
- Documentation of outcomes related to the incident, including arrests, charges, or other resolutions.

Case Reports or Investigative Documents
- Any incident reports, supplemental reports, or internal memos related to this incident.
I
 am willing to pay any reasonable fees associated with fulfilling this request. However, if the cost exceeds [dollar amount, e.g., $50], please contact me first to discuss options.

If any part of my request is unclear or overly broad, I request that you contact me to clarify or refine my request. If any of the requested records are withheld, please provide a specific citation to the exemption being claimed under the applicable FOIA law and describe how it applies to the information being withheld.

I request the documents be provided to me electronically via email, if possible.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert McWhirter

communications.subject: Re: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Men Firing Rifles on Washington St.
communications.communication:
I am out of the office until Tuesday, November 12, and I will answer your email when I return to the office.  

If you need immediate assistance, please contact Chief Deputy Clerk Brandi Jones at (276) 223-3353, brandij@wytheville.org, or Deputy Clerk Lauren Bedwell at lauren.bedwell@wytheville.org, (276) 223-3367.
Thanks!

Since your request has to do with the Police Department, I am forwarding your FOIA request to Police Chief Joel Hash who is the FOIA Officer for the Wytheville Police Department, and he will take care of answering this request for you.

 

Have a great day!

 

Sherry Corvin, CMC 

Town Clerk 

Town of Wytheville 

P.O. Box 533, 150 East Monroe Street 

Wytheville, VA 24382 

(276) 223-3349

Thanks,

-Bob

Wytheville Police Department

Chief Hash

communications.subject: Maine Freedom of Access Act Request: Psychics
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maine Freedom of Access Act, I hereby request the following records:

In October 2001, a 25 year old woman named Amy Saint Laurent disappeared. The PPD contacted a psychic named Vicki Monroe - a spirit investigator - to help find her.  I am looking for:
- any communications (emails, letters, phone calls) with Vicki Monroe from 2000 until the date this request is processed. 
- any communications (emails, letters, phone calls) with any forensic psychics or mediums from 2000 until the date this request is processed. 
- any investigatory records produced by any forensic psychic or hypnotist during the course of any investigation by the PPD since 2000. 
- records reflecting the number of cases psychics or hypnosis has been used by PPD since the year 2000.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by 1 M.R.S.A. § 408(6). The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dhruv Mehrotra

communications.subject: Re: Maine Freedom of Access Act Request: Psychics
communications.communication:
Hello-
I have read the FOAA and I have forwarded it to Major Martin of CID and Esq
Nicole Albert.
Thank you
Dt. Lt. Nick Goodman

-- 
Notice: Under Maine law, documents - including e-mails - in the possession 
of public officials or city employees about government business may be 
classified as public records. There are very few exceptions. As a result, 
please be advised that what is written in an e-mail could be released to 
the public and/or the media if requested.

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Service Call History
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide all service call history/events for the address of 4331 Wallace Circle in Tampa, FL 33611 that your agency (Tampa Police Department) responded to provide service for the date range of April 01, 2018 through April 30, 2020.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Shawn McKenzie

communications.communication:
Dear MuckRock News: 
The City is in receipt of the below public records request and it will be forwarded to the appropriate department(s) for a response to determine if such a record(s) exists. All City records are open for personal inspection and copying by any person except for portions of records which contain exempt or confidential information which may not be disclosed unless otherwise permitted by law.  While the City strives to provide access to public records by remote electronic means, it is necessary that the records are reviewed for possible exempt or confidential information prior to disclosure.  Should the records contain exempt or confidential information that is required to be redacted, the City will need to bill for the time expended on making the necessary redactions.  Should any extraordinary time be required, the City charges administrative fees as authorized by Florida Statutes.  An estimate of charges will be provided for prepayment prior to work being processed. 
Records Requested: "[PUBLICRECORDDESIRED]" 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the City of Tampa Public Records Center. 
City of Tampa

title: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (Department of Homeland Security)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (Department of Homeland Security)
communications.communication:
Dear Department of Homeland Security,

On behalf of myself and Fiat Fiendum, I hereby request the following records:

1. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email inbox or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
2. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email spam folder or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
3. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's sent email folder or equivalent which was sent nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
4. The total full-time equivalent count of people who work for your FOIA office as of October 19, 2024.

This request is expressly limited to Department of Homeland Security's own FOIA office. Please do not refer it to any other agency or division. This request is expressly not a Privacy Act request, and no PA waiver will be provided.

Please provide the email records in EML, Maildir, MBOX, MIX, MSG, or PST format only — not PDF, Word, image, etc — including all metadata (e.g. full email headers as received/sent) and attachments, without alteration other than narrowly tailored electronic redaction of specifically claimed exemptions that do not affect any part of non exempt information (and, in particular, without rasterization).

Please provide the fourth record as a statement in your response letter, or at your option, as the most readily available record, in original electronic format as currently stored on your computer systems, which includes that information.

Please provide all records either as individual files, or as an unencrypted ZIP file, uploaded to MuckRock. Do not apply any encryption, DRM, or other restriction.

I request fee waiver, because
* Fiat Fiendum is a 501(c)(3) non-profit;
* this request is for public interest, non-commercial purposes;
* these records would give a snapshot of insight into the everyday processes of FOIA offices; and
* these records are being requested in order to conduct a government-wide audit of agencies' FOIA compliance.

In the event that you deny fee waiver, please process this request as-is, because I will not agree to any fees.

Please be sure to provide:
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(II) FOIA Public Liaison information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(aa) appeal information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(bb) OGIS information
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(A) tracking number
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(B)(ii) completion ETA

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
Sai
President, Fiat Fiendum, Inc.

P.S. Sai is my full legal name.

communications.subject: Your verification code
communications.communication: Your confirmation code is 774051

communications.subject: Department of Homeland Security FOIA 2025-HQFO-00639 Acknowledgment
communications.communication:
10/23/2024 

SENT VIA E-MAIL TO:  174937-73553938@requests.muckrock.com 

P.S. Sai 
MuckRock News, DEPT MR174937 
Boston, Massachusetts 02115 

Re:  2025-HQFO-00639 

Dear Requester: 

This letter acknowledges receipt of your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), dated 10/22/2024, and to your request for a waiver of all assessable FOIA fees.  Our office received your request on 10/22/2024.  Specifically, you requested 

1. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email inbox or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter. 
2. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email spam folder or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter. 
3. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's sent email folder or equivalent which was sent nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter. 
4. The total full-time equivalent count of people who work for your FOIA office as of October 19, 2024.. 

Due to the increasing number of FOIA requests received by this office, we may encounter some delay in processing your request.  Consistent with 6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.5(a) of the DHS FOIA regulations, the Department processes FOIA requests according to their order of receipt.  Although DHS’ goal is to respond within 20 business days of receipt of your request, FOIA does permit a 10-day extension of this time period in certain circumstances under 6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.5(c). 

You have requested a fee waiver.  The DHS FOIA regulations at 6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.11(k) set forth six factors DHS must evaluate to determine whether the applicable legal standard for a fee waiver has been met:  (1) Whether the subject of the requested records concerns “the operations or activities of the government,” (2) Whether the disclosure is “likely to contribute” to an understanding of government operations or activities, (3) Whether disclosure of the requested information will contribute to the understanding of the public at large, as opposed to the individual understanding of the requester or a narrow segment of interested persons, (4) Whether the contribution to public understanding of government operations or activities will be “significant,” (5) Whether the requester has a commercial interest that would be furthered by the requested disclosure, and (6) Whether the magnitude of any identified commercial interest to the requester is sufficiently large in comparison with the public interest in disclosure, that disclosure is primarily in the commercial interest of the requester. 

Upon review of the subject matter of your request, and an evaluation of the six factors identified above, DHS has determined that it will conditionally grant your request for a fee waiver.  The fee waiver determination will be based upon a sampling of the responsive documents received from the various DHS program offices as a result of the searches conducted in response to your FOIA request.  DHS will, pursuant to DHS FOIA regulations applicable to non-commercial requesters, provide two hours of search time and process the first 100 pages at no charge to you.  If upon review of these documents, DHS determines that the disclosure of the information contained in those documents does not meet the factors permitting DHS to waive the fees, then DHS will at that time either deny your request for a fee waiver entirely, or will allow for a percentage reduction in the amount of the fees corresponding to the amount of relevant material found that meets the factors allowing for a fee waiver.  In either case, DHS will promptly notify you of its final decision regarding your request for a fee waiver and provide you with the responsive records as required by applicable law. 

In the event that your fee waiver is denied, and you determine that you still want the records, provisions of the FOIA allow us to recover part of the cost of complying with your request.  We shall charge you for records in accordance with the DHS FOIA regulations as they apply to non-commercial requesters.  As a non-commercial requester you will be charged for any search time and duplication beyond the free two hours and 100 pages mentioned in the previous paragraph.  You will be charged 10 cents per page for duplication and search time at the per quarter-hour rate ($4.00 for clerical personnel, $7.00 for professional personnel, $10.25 for managerial personnel) of the searcher.  In the event that your fee waiver is denied, we will construe the submission of your request as an agreement to pay up to $25.00.  This office will contact you before accruing any additional fees. 

We have queried the appropriate component(s) of DHS for responsive records.  If any responsive records are located, they will be reviewed for determination of releasability.  Please be assured that one of the analysts in our office will respond to your request as expeditiously as possible.  We appreciate your patience as we proceed with your request. 

Your request has been assigned reference number 2025-HQFO-00639.  Please refer to this identifier in any future correspondence. If you have any questions, or would like to discuss this matter, please feel free to contact this office at 1-866-431-0486 or 202-343-1743.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2025-HQFO-00639
communications.communication:
Dear DHS,

Thank you for your email and for your conditional grant of fee waiver.

My name is just Sai. "P.S." means "post scriptum". Please update your records accordingly.

Sincerely,
Sai

communications.subject: FOIA 2025-HQFO-00639
communications.communication:
Hi Mr. Sai: 

The purpose of this email is to obtain clarification on the above-referenced FOIA request which was received in our office on October 22, 2024. Your request sought the following: 

1. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email inbox or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter. 
2. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email spam folder or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter. 
3. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's sent email folder or equivalent which was sent nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter. 
4. The total full-time equivalent count of people who work for your FOIA office as of October 19, 2024. 

In your original request you stated the following: 

“This request is expressly limited to Department of Homeland Security's own FOIA office. Please do not refer it to any other agency or division.” 

We understand this statement to mean that the records responsive to this request are confined to the DHS Office of Privacy, where the Chief FOIA Officer for DHS is located. Additionally, there is only one designated individual in this position at DHS. Please confirm that this interpretation is correct by November 26, 2024. 

If confirmed, we will proceed with processing the response to this request. This also means that similar requests sent to other DHS components will be administratively closed, as our office would be the only one with records responsive to this request. 

If we do not receive a response by this date, we will proceed as stated above. 

If you have any questions, please let me know. 

Greg Bridges 
Director, Disclosure 
DHS Privacy Office

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2025-HQFO-00639
communications.communication:
Dear DHS,

Thank you for your email.

My title is not "Mr.". Please use no title for me at all if you are able to do so, or "Mx" if your system forces you to enter a title. Please update your records accordingly.

You wrote:
> We understand this statement to mean that the records responsive to this request are confined to the DHS Office of Privacy, where the Chief FOIA Officer for DHS is located. Additionally, there is only one designated individual in this position at DHS. Please confirm that this interpretation is correct by November 26, 2024.

In this specific request, 2025-HQFO-00639, the first three (email) records are confined to the primary email address used by the DHS Chief FOIA Officer. It is not confined by 'office', as that's not how email works. It's also not based on the "FOIA box" or similar; it's based on the identified officer's email.

The fourth record (FTE FOIA employees) in this request is confined to the DHS Office of Privacy.

> This also means that similar requests sent to other DHS components will be administratively closed, as our office would be the only one with records responsive to this request.

I do not agree or consent to this. 

FOIA applies to each individual "agency", "whether or not it is within or subject to review by another agency", not only to Departments. 5 USC 552(f)(1), 551(1). See e.g. Energy Research v. Defense Nuclear Facilities, 917 F. 2d 581, 582 (D.C. Cir. 1990) 
 and Sussman v. US Marshals Service, 808 F. Supp. 2d 192, 199 (D.C. Cir. 2011).

Similar requests sent to DHS component agencies refer to that agency's own chief FOIA officer (or equivalent, whatever their formal designation), not to DHS'. The "expressly limited" clause is explicit on this, and was written to specifically preclude your proposed interpretation that would have requests which were made specifically to DHS component agencies be ignored. In any case, even if it were ambiguous, I have now clarified my intent, which is binding.

Sincerely,
Sai

communications.subject: New Message - 2025-HQFO-00639
communications.communication:
"My Apologies Sai:

Regarding our previous email, could you please confirm our interpretation of your request? We want to make sure we're searching the correct mailbox within the Department for responsive records. Also, by November 26, 2024, could you confirm that the emails with the latest timestamp in the Chief FOIA Officer's inbox, spam, and sent folder would be the emails that are responsive to this request?

Greg Bridges
Director, Disclosure
DHS Privacy Office"

communications.subject: Authentication Code
communications.communication: Your authentication code is 996874

communications.subject: New Message - 2025-HQFO-00639
communications.communication:
"Hi Sai:

I'm just following up on this request. We are currently processing our response to your request based on the clarification you provided in a previous email.

However, I wanted to just confirm that you only are interested in the Chief FOIA Officer's communication. The reason I wanted to confirm this is because no other DHS FOIA office would have records for this request because there is only one Chief FOIA officer for the entire department. My office is currently working on that response. Please confirm.

Thanks
Greg Bridges"

communications.subject: Iowa Open Records Law Request: Agency Roster (Hardin Sheriff)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Iowa Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide records sufficient to show a current staff roster of all sworn employees with your agency.

Please include;
- first and last name of each employee with their corresponding;
- badge number
- employee identification number
- hire date
- rank or position
- assigned duty station/substation/precinct/location
- current salary

This request applies to ALL sworn Department employees, including those at substations.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Marcus Boyd

communications.subject: FOIA Case 2024-02577-F Clarification
communications.communication:
FOIA Case# 2024-02577-F

The Air Force Personnel Center (AFPC), Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) Request Service Center (RSC) office received your 27 Feb 24 via transfer from AFIMSC on 29 Jul 24 for processing.  Your request requires clarification to perfect your request.


  *   Assigned case number is 2024-02577-F.
  *   AFPC target date to respond to your request was 26 Mar 24 (Could change pending your response to this clarification or additional questions.
  *   AFPC tentatively holds a request in suspension pending response but not later than 12 Sep 24 (10 days, not including weekends).
  *   While in suspension, processing workdays are not charged on FOIA case IAW FOIA guidelines.
  *   Hold workdays are added to target date which adjusts response to a new target date.

If AFPC does not receive a response by 12 Sep 24, governing guidelines permit request to be closed IAW DoDM 5400.07_ AFMAN 33-302, Section 6.3 paragraph b., Reasons for Denying a FOIA Request Other than Exemptions.  If closed, you may submit a new request.

DoDM 5400.07_AFMAN 33-302, Freedom of Information Program Web Site:
https://static.e-publishing.af.mil/production/1/saf_cio_a6/publication/dodm5400.07_afman33-302/dodm5400.07_afman33-302.pdf


YOUR REQUEST SEEKS:
"To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Can you please produce all records pertaining to the personnel file of Mason C. Turner FCC RN:0021576244, under the Department of Defense, Department of the Airforce, 38th Cyberspace Readiness Squadron, 4th Communications wing of the MARS program. Please include personnel action reports. To aid in your search I have attached previously unencrypted email documents with a classification no higher than FOIA. It is understood that redactions may need to be made in your resulting personnel file.

This request is not being made for commercial purposes.

There should not be any fees associated with this request but in the event that there are fees, please fulfill my request along with an attached invoice. Delivery via email attachment is preferred and authorized.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Mason C. Turner

Attachments:

https://cdn.muckrock.com/outbound_composer_attachments/MasonC.Turner/133182/USAF_Redacted_jWxfYHy.pdf
https://cdn.muckrock.com/outbound_composer_attachments/MasonC.Turner/133182/AF_MARS_Application-Appvd-KK4HOR-Turner_Mason_Craig-190730.pdf
https://cdn.muckrock.com/outbound_composer_attachments/MasonC.Turner/133182/3661-NewMember-AFT4YC-Turner_Mason_Craig-190730.pdf

Correction on classification level, The maximum classification level for the documents attached is FOUO and these were transmitted over unencrypted open email."


NARROW THE SCOPE:

Please read the detailed descriptions of the requested information:


  *   Please provide more context for the individual you are seeking information on.  Were they previously or currently an Active-duty Air Force service member? We they previously or currently a civilian employee?

Please advise that 3rd Party requesters are not entitled to member's personnel files without redactions as stated under the following exempt:

Protected from release: Title 5, United States Code (U.S.C.), Section 552 (b)(6). Information in personnel and medical files, as well as similar personal information in other files, that, if disclosed to a requester, other than the person about whom the information is about, would result in a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy. Release of information about an individual contained in a Privacy Act System of records that would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of privacy is prohibited and could subject the releaser to civil and criminal penalties. If the information qualifies as exemption 6 information, there is no discretion in its release.

If you do not agree, your request could be processed as a "partial denial" or "full denial". These require additional coordination with several offices, to include a legal review, before signature and release by higher level approval authority. These responses generally add several days to weeks in processing time and appeal rights shall be given in your response letter.

WITHDRAW YOUR REQUEST
Should you decide to withdraw your request after reading this clarification e-mail, our agency would only need your e-mail response stating: "I wish to officially withdraw my FOIA request." We will close your request with no further action by us.

You may contact the Air Force FOIA Public Liaison Officer, Robert Bivins, concerning this clarification at Air Force FOIA Public Liaison Office (SAF/CN), 1800 Air Force Pentagon, Washington, DC 20330-1800 or DAF.FOIA@us.af.mil<mailto:DAF.FOIA@us.af.mil>, (703) 614-8500.

Additionally, you may contact the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) at the National Archives and Records Administration to inquire about the FOIA mediation services they offer. The contact information for OGIS is as follows: Office of Government Information Services, National Archives and Records Administration, 8601 Adelphi Road-OGIS, College Park, Maryland 20740-6001, e-mail at ogis@nara.gov<mailto:ogis@nara.gov>; telephone at telephone at 202-741-5770; toll free at 1-877-684-6448; or facsimile at 202-741-5769.


//SIGNED//
AFPC/DSMIF FOIA/PA OFFICE
JBSA - Randolph AFB, TX
550 5th Street West
Joint Base San Antonio-Randolph, TX 78150
DSN:665-2751 Comm 210-565-2751
afpc.dsmif.foia.pa@us.af.mil<mailto:afpc.dsmif.foia.pa@us.af.mil>

title: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (U.S. Patent and Trademark Office)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (U.S. Patent and Trademark Office)
communications.communication:
Dear U.S. Patent and Trademark Office,

On behalf of myself and Fiat Fiendum, I hereby request the following records:

1. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email inbox or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
2. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email spam folder or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
3. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's sent email folder or equivalent which was sent nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
4. The total full-time equivalent count of people who work for your FOIA office as of October 19, 2024.

This request is expressly limited to U.S. Patent and Trademark Office's own FOIA office. Please do not refer it to any other agency or division. This request is expressly not a Privacy Act request, and no PA waiver will be provided.

Please provide the email records in EML, Maildir, MBOX, MIX, MSG, or PST format only — not PDF, Word, image, etc — including all metadata (e.g. full email headers as received/sent) and attachments, without alteration other than narrowly tailored electronic redaction of specifically claimed exemptions that do not affect any part of non exempt information (and, in particular, without rasterization).

Please provide the fourth record as a statement in your response letter, or at your option, as the most readily available record, in original electronic format as currently stored on your computer systems, which includes that information.

Please provide all records either as individual files, or as an unencrypted ZIP file, uploaded to MuckRock. Do not apply any encryption, DRM, or other restriction.

I request fee waiver, because
* Fiat Fiendum is a 501(c)(3) non-profit;
* this request is for public interest, non-commercial purposes;
* these records would give a snapshot of insight into the everyday processes of FOIA offices; and
* these records are being requested in order to conduct a government-wide audit of agencies' FOIA compliance.

In the event that you deny fee waiver, please process this request as-is, because I will not agree to any fees.

Please be sure to provide:
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(II) FOIA Public Liaison information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(aa) appeal information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(bb) OGIS information
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(A) tracking number
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(B)(ii) completion ETA

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
Sai
President, Fiat Fiendum, Inc.

P.S. Sai is my full legal name.

title: Prostitution and Related Charging Documents (Providence Police Department)

communications.subject: Rhode Island Access to Public Records Act Request: Prostitution and Related Charging Documents (Providence Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Rhode Island Access to Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All charging documents filed by your department in all cases of:

11-34.1-2. Prostitution
11-34.1-3. Procurement of sexual conduct for a fee.
11-34-11. Loitering for indecent purposes in or near schools
11-34.1-6 Soliciting from a vehicle
23-20.8-3 Practicing massage without a license

filed by your department between July of 2021 and the date this request is fulfilled.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Bella Robinson

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: RNG in NYS study materials
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

All meeting minutes, monthly progress reports, draft reports, slide decks, and other work products related to the work performed under Contracts #151553 and 151533-1 regarding RNG potential in New York State. 

Please limit the search window to 2/19/2020 to the date the search is conducted.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Madeleine Stone

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: RNG in NYS study materials
communications.communication:
Dear Madeleine Stone:

I write to acknowledge receipt of the FOIL request that you submitted to the New York State Energy Research and Development Authority ("NYSERDA").  Your request seeks the information outlined below.

Your request has been referred to the appropriate NYSERDA program areas to search for the records that are responsive to your request.  NYSERDA will contact you in twenty (20) business days to (i) advise whether it has any records that are responsive to your request; (ii) grant or deny your request, if it has responsive records; or (iii) apprise you of the progress of your request, if the search or review of the records that you requested is still on-going.

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: RNG in NYS study materials
communications.communication:
Good Afternoon Madeleine Stone-

The New York State Energy Research and Development Authority ("NYSERDA") requires additional time to process your request and review the responsive records to determine whether the records fall under an exemption contained in the NY Public Officers Law section 87(2).  I note that this request and your February 2, 2024 request (see below) appear to be seeking the same records.  Please advise whether either the February 2 or March 18 can be withdrawn as duplicative.  NYSERDA anticipates completing your request, unless you advise us to withdraw it, by June 28, 2024 and will let you know if additional time is needed.  Thank you.

February 2, 2024 request
All email correspondences (including email attachments), meeting minutes, and presentation documents from meetings between NYSDERA officials and ICF energy consultant Maurice Oldham that contain one or more of the following search terms:
> Renewable Natural Gas
> RNG
Please limit the search window to email correspondences and meetings that occurred between January 1, 2020 and April 1, 2022.

Colleen Dawson
Senior Counsel and Records Access Officer

NYSERDA
17 Columbia Circle | Albany, NY 12203-6399

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: RNG in NYS study materials
communications.communication:
Dear Madeleine Stone:

The New York State Energy Research and Development Authority continues to review the emails and attachments responsive to your Freedom of Information Law request.  This review includes determining whether any information should be withheld from disclosure under the exemptions set forth in NY Public Officers Law section 87(2).  I note that any emails or attachments which include proprietary, confidential, or business sensitive information are required to undergo an additional review by ICF as set forth in NY Public Officers Law section 89(5).  This additional review entails NYSERDA seeking a confidentiality justification letter from ICF, ICF reviewing each responsive email and attachment sent to it and drafting a letter to NYSERDA with its confidentiality assertions.

Given this, NYSERDA anticipates completing its review of the responsive records no later than September 20.

Thank you for your continued patience.


Colleen Dawson
Senior Counsel

NYSERDA
17 Columbia Circle | Albany, NY 12203-6399
P: 518-862-1090 ext. 3454 | C: 518-928-7510 | Email: Colleen.Dawson@nyserda.ny.gov<mailto:Colleen.Dawson@nyserda.ny.gov>
